Stairway to Heaven

The Haʻikū Stairs, also known as the Stairway to Heaven or Haʻikū Ladder, is a steep hiking trail on the island of Oʻahu, Hawaii.[1] The total 3,922 steps span along Oahu's Ko'olau mountain range.

Island Exploration

The North Shore is the north-facing coastal area of Oʻahu between Kaʻena Point and Kahuku.This area is best known for its massive waves, attracting surfers from all around the globe.

Beaches

Waikiki Beach is a neighborhood of Honolulu on the south shore of the island of Oʻahu in the U.S. state of Hawaii. Waikiki is most famous for Waikiki Beach, which is one of six beaches in the district, along with Queen's Beach, Kuhio Beach, Gray's Beach, Fort DeRussy Beach and Kahanamoku Beach
